Data:
The dehumidifier has been a fantastic addition to my basement. It efficiently covers up to 3000 square feet, maintaining a comfortable humidity level with ease. Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2023
Data:
This arrived in perfect condition and quickly. I unboxed it and left it in an upright position for 24 hours BEFORE plugging it in to prevent compressor damage and extend the service life of the unit, as you should do with any product that has a compressor, to allow the oil to resettle back into the compressor from the lines due to movement during transit.
It connected quickly to my Android smartphone via their app, available for free from the Play Store and integrated seamlessly with my Alexa ecosystem, which is robust to say the least. Easily turned on, off, raised and lowered the fan speed via voice, which is primarily what drove me to purchase this product. As a bonus, I had a small Govee remote sensor for temperature and humidity that paired with the unit to provide remote sensing capabilities, which was very handy when trying to keep a large space properly dehumidified.
The app is easy to use and customer service is handled through the app, which is VERY nice and super convenient. I thought I had an issue with the compressor not turning on and off but via messaging through the chat in the app, they were able to see the log of the machine's components and determine it was my misunderstanding of how the Auto function worked.
The unit itself works well to remove excess humidity from our home. With the unit on high and the relative humidity being 60%, it fills the tank in around 10 hours, making our home feel more comfortable at 74F and 52% RH than at 72F and 60% RH. It does emit heat though, as is the case with any dehumidifier, so mitigating that is simply a case of having the fan on our central AC unit come on for 15 minutes every hour to help move the dehumidified air and warmer air out of the room. We keep the unit in the living room, our largest room in our 1700 sqft. living space and it definitely helps keep the entire space more comfortable, again using the central air fan only function to move air around the entire space.
The water tank is one of the largest I could find at 2 gallons. I didn't want to hang a hose out of the window to automatically drain the unit, but I did try out the auto drain function and it does work really well to pump the water out without the use of the integrated water tank, a nice feature for sure, especially if you have a floor drain or put the unit in close proximity of the window. The unit is easy to maintain - a washable filter screen on the back of the unit makes keeping the coils clean and the unit in top working condition a breeze.
We are very happy with this purchase. We've had it up and running for about a month now and have already noticed shorter run times on the central AC due to not needing to crank the temperature down to get the 'stickiness' out of the air. We live in the 'deep south' on the coast and high humidity is just a way of life. This helps the house feel much more comfortable and that's important to us.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2024
Data:
Short version: Great appliance, highly efficient, easy integration with the Govee app, extensive amount of control through app, high capacity 2 gal tank that’s easy to empty or connect to garden hose or use provided adapter to use drain tube provided (or go to Lowes/Home Depot to get longer tube and avoid ugly garden hose in the house), not overly loud - can’t tell it’s on when the A/C is running, makes it far more comfortable and takes strain off the A/C during extreme temps & high humidity.
Long Version:
Originally fell in love with Govee LED lights and grew to trust the brand more over the years through various warranty replacements and honestly outstanding customer service through any issue/concern.
I’ll admit, I was semi skeptical when they began venturing into various home appliances.
The app is great and works flawlessly with every Govee product I own (Many lights, Hygrometer/Thermometers, Space Heater and now Dehumidifer).
The dehumidifier is extremely efficient, I can track my energy usage through my smart meter and it typically pulls about 800-850 watts on high and roughly 780 watts with fan on low. For comparison - my central air pulls 2,400 watts.
I love the ability to pair any of my Hygrometers to control the humidity in any one particular area and set it to maintain whatever set point you select within the app. Also, when paired with a Hygrometer and connected to WiFi, you have more visibility/control into your environment remotely in the app, as it allows you to check the humidity/temp from anywhere instead of only within Bluetooth range.
On high, it removes a LOT of moisture relatively quickly. I live in a 1,200 sqft apartment and leave it by my master bath which pumps out the most humidity from my scalding showers lol. Within about 30-45mins, the humidity drops from 82% to 50% and provides peace of mind knowing it’s preventing mold in poorly ventilated areas.
It’s a great assistance to the A/C during extremely hot & humid days as well, and prevented my coils from freezing up during a recent severe heatwave. Also, to be able to open the windows on cooler, but humid nights/days and run the dehumidifier instead of the A/C, using a fraction of the energy is very nice and provides a bit of versatility as an alternative to “overcooling” to dehimidify.
My one complaint and only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is the way the “maintain” feature works when you want to maintain a particular threshold instead of running it 24/7.
As the humidity gets closer to the desired set point, the unit decreases the fan speed to low once it’s about 3% away from its target. From a logical prospective, the fan is the cheapest component of the unit to operate as the condenser is not variable and therefore either on 100% or off.
Once the fan speed decreases, it takes notably longer to reach the target set point vs allowing it to run on high continuously until the target is reached, which ultimately decreases the overall efficiency.
If Govee updated the firmware to “maintain” the threshold by running the fan on high continuously until the target is reached, I would immediately update this to 5 stars.
Aside from that, I have zero complaints and plan to purchase another unit for my parents if the price is right on Prime Day.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2024
Data:
EDIT: With the Pelonis' help the Govee can now get down to 46-47. The problem is it has to go through a defrost cycle at points, which means it won't be running, and if your basement gets humid in seconds, you're toast. There's also an over heat shutoff (which the Pelonis doesn't need because it exhausts the hot air as it runs, which contributes to its efficiency).
Bottom line, I would STRONGLY recommend not relying on this alone. It's not strong enough to handle humid situations alone and even if it manages, the overheat and defrost cycles will cause it to fall right back behind.
The sellers left behind a Pelonis dehumidifier (not properly connected). I got it fully running, and it has been able to maintain 45-50 relative humidity fairly well without going to the high setting. I'm of the opinion that the hot air it blows is the key to its performance.
I wanted to try the GoveeLife for the ability to monitor and adjust without having to go downstairs, and I already have a bunch of Govee devices.
The GoveeLife looks nice, but struggled to get the humidity down from 60 to 50 even on the max or Auto settings, hovering instead around the 54-56 range. We're in cold season; and the dew point is quite a bit higher than usual, but I was surprised to see it struggle given the basement is not that large. Online sources indicate that the in-built hygrometer may not be calibrated properly, and may be misreading the humidity; in my experience it's not too far off from the Pelonis, so I don't believe it to be a calibration issue. I think it's relying too much on just regular air movement and not heating of the air in conjuction with air movement.
For now, I have the Pelonis in an opposing corner set to a lower level to try and help the GoveeLife get caught up at least. As I type this, it's down to 52 -53 and slowly dropping; so I strongly question the 4500 sq ft claims (the Pelonis is about 15 feet away and running on the lowest setting).

Data: The dehumidifier unit works pretty well. I have been able to get 1,000 square feet down to 42% even when outside is over 90%. I did have some issues with the product. There was no warning on the product page that it uses the new refrigerant, I purchased the unit this year because I thought it was using the old refrigerant which isn't flammable. Second, the hose which was included was too small a diameter. There is a nozzle for a garden hose attachment which is better than a simple hose as the garden hose can be tightened and won't be easily pulled out. Finally, the app which controls the unit is a general "Govee" app, designed to work with a lot of Govee products. As such it requires a lot more permissions than an IOT app should have. Such as exact location, which just should never be required for any application that isn't navigation related. Perhaps it might be required for other products, but I'm not using those products so it should be allowed to be shutoff. Also, located nearby devices. This device is wifi only, not bluetooth. It should not require this permission on an ongoing basis. Unless you want to discover other nearby devices in my home, which again, shouldn't be required for this specific product. This seems to be typical of all Chinese company apps, poorly written for privacy.

Felt the price was right on this one and went for it.
And I will tell you, especially with the insane summer we have been having, this product is a lifesaver.
I live in one of the most miserably humid parts of the US so AC is critical to living here. Every summer even with use leaving the AC at 80 during the day we still had power bills approaching $500 and we'd be utterly miserable during our work day as the humidity would build because the AC wasn't running much.
With this, keeping the house at 80 degrees is so much more comfortable as it helps clear the humidity that builds up from me being in a small space for my work day.
I know that might be too extreme for some of you but I think if you get this product try leaving your house at 77 or 78 and it'll feel so much better than you would expect.
And the real kicker is that I added this new appliance that runs for 8-10 hours a day but it actually has SAVED money on my electricity bill.
The reason for that is my AC is not having to work nearly as hard because it is receiving far less humid air at the intake. My power bill this previous month was $380 and the same month last year it was around $460.
This product will have paid for itself by the time cooler temps hit in late fall.
Really cannot highly recommend this unit enough.

Data:
I bought a house a while ago and the basement is damp. Like the drywall was getting soggy. Tools are rusting in the garage. Didn't know what to do.
Enter the govee dehumidifier. Got two- fast shipping, good packaging, super easy to set up. Phenomenal app.
My basement has a humidity level of over 75%. Set this guy up and within less than 8 hours it is a nice 32-35%. It isnt even loud. I am so thrilled i buy another for a workroom.
The second one has an issue. It won't recognize the bucket/thinks the bucket is full. I try a few things. Google it. Finally reach out to govee. After less than a week of troubleshooting (responsive feedback in a good frame of time) they send out a replacement. The new one works like a charm.
I ended up buying a third for my garage. I love these guys. Love that I can check them from anywhere- work, bed, making breakfast. 1 is set up to drain via tube but the other two use the built in bucket. I love the feature that sends my phone an alert when the bucket is full. If that feature didn't exist i would have to go check every day multiple times. Saves me a lot of time.
Going to set up the other 2 to drain automatically and then hopefully live knowing my basement is not a humid mess all summer.
Love Govee- keep making more stuff (like an in wall AC, garage door opener, etc)

Data:
I purchased this dehumidifier in July, and was impressed with its operation. By the beginning of October, the unit wasn't collecting any water and the humidity level in my home kept rising. In summary: There's apparently design flaw in this unit which causes it to fail within a few months, since I'm 2 for 2 with units having this issue. Unfortunately, the second time, Govee washed their hands of me and ignored their warranty. If this is how the company treats its customers, I'd suggest you spend your money elsewhere. I'm highly disappointed, and sure do wish I had my money back.
EDIT: Govee finally agreed to send me a replacement. Assuming it gets here, I’m at least grateful that they’re standing by their product, even if this unit has issues.
